TEXT: The applicant is a NORP citizen , born in DATE and living in GPE ) . She is represented before the Court by Ms Irmgard Möbus - Hohl , a lawyer practising in Föhren .
A.
The facts of the case , as submitted by the applicant , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE the applicant , who had been living and working in GPE , bought a house in GPE ( PERSON ) , GPE . At that time GPE was CARDINAL of the republics of ORG ) and the applicant , as a citizen of that state , was legally entitled to buy property without restrictions in the whole territory of GPE . Although she lived in GPE , the applicant encountered no obstacles whatsoever to enter GPE and use her property there .

After the dissolution of GPE in DATE , the situation changed significantly for the applicant . As a citizen of GPE she is now a foreign citizen in GPE and her entry and stay in the territory of GPE are subject to some restrictions .
On DATE the applicant requested and on DATE obtained a permission for an extended stay in GPE until DATE from ORG .
Subsequently the applicant left GPE and returned to GPE . In her absence the house was burgled and partly demolished .

On DATE the applicant lodged a request for permanent residence in GPE with ORG in GPE , GPE . As by that time she had retired , she planned to live permanently in her house in GPE . On DATE ORG refused her request .
On DATE the applicant instituted administrative proceedings with ORG , contesting the decision of ORG . On DATE that court ruled against the applicant .
On DATE the applicant lodged a constitutional complaint arguing that her right to property was violated as she was denied by the NORP authorities access to her property in GPE .

On DATE ORG rejected her complaint . It found that , although the applicant was the owner of a house in GPE and despite the fact that she was in bad health , that she was single and with a residence in GPE where she had sufficient means for living , she did not satisfy conditions for a permanent residence in GPE as set out in the Movement and Stay of Aliens Act ( Zakon o kretanju i boravku stranaca ) .
B. Relevant domestic law
Movement and Stay of Aliens Act ( DATE )
Article CARDINAL

“ A foreigner may enter GPE and stay in its territory if he is the holder of a valid passport issued according to the relevant legal provisions of a foreign state or of a valid travel document for foreign citizens issued by the ORG authority competent for issuing such documents . Such a passport or travel document should contain a visa , save where this LAW provides otherwise . ”
Article CARDINAL
“ A visa is given to a foreign citizen for entering , leaving or passing through the territory of GPE . ”
“ The Government of GPE may decide that citizens of certain countries do not need visas to enter , leave or pass through the territory of GPE . ”
“ Visas may be issued for CARDINAL entry or for an unlimited number of entries . ”
“ Visas shall be issued for a period of DATE or until the expiration of a foreign passport , if that date falls within DATE from the date of issue of visa . ”
Article CARDINAL

“ Stay of a foreign citizen in GPE shall include : temporary stay , extended stay , stay with a business visa , stay on the basis of authorised permanent residence and stay on the basis of recognised refugee status . ”
